DataElement.preferredName: Record Identification Patient Hospital System Unique Identifier Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The unique, non-repeating number automatically assigned to patients by the hospital tumor registry software system.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Record Identification Patient Hospital System Identifier
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The non-repeating number automatically assigned to patients by the hospital tumor registry software system. The same number is used for all the patient's subsequent tumors.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Record; anything, e.g. a document, providing permanent evidence of or information about past events.:Identified; having the identity known or established.

Concepts.definition: Anything (e.g., a document) providing permanent evidence of or information about past events.
The procedure of having an identity established.

Property.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.:An institution that provides medical, surgical, or psychiatric care and treatment for the sick or the injured.:a group of independent but interrelated elements comprising a unified whole.:One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.
An institution that provides medical, surgical, or psychiatric care and treatment for the sick or the injured.
A group of independent but interrelated elements comprising a unified whole.
One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

DataElementConcept.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The non-repeating number automatically assigned to patients by the hospital tumor registry software system. The same number is used for all the patient's subsequent tumors.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The single one of its kind.:One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: The single one of its kind.
One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

ValueDomain.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Division of Cancer Control and Population Sciences

ReferenceDocuments.name: NAACCR, V 11.1 Data Stds/Dict.
ReferenceDocuments.description: For additional details see NAACCR, Standards for Cancer Registries Volume II, Version 11.1 Data Standards and Data Dictionary (5/4/06)

ReferenceDocuments.name: Patient System Hospital ID Description
ReferenceDocuments.description: The same number is used for all the patient's subsequent tumors. This Patient System ID-Hosp number should not be reused when a patient is deleted. This number is different from Accession Number-Hosp [550]. While Accession Number-Hosp [550] is subject to change, the Patient System ID-Hosp number is created and maintained by the hospital tumor registry's software system, and requires no key entry. Because the Patient System ID-Hosp number is unchanging, it affords an absolute linkage between a hospital patient record and a central registry's patient record.
